properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 v3 v4 v5

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Alas, my lady you've done me dirt You`ve sewn green sleeves to my purple shirt And then you've done me worse than that You've made me go out and wear it

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Oh, Oh, what a dismal fate To be seen at events in this terrible state Oh, how I wish I could come late Say, seven days/week/years after it's over

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Alas, my lady I'm born to lose You've sewn pink bows to my purple shoes You've done my hair up in waves and curls My mother thinks I'm a girl

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Alas, my lady why did you think My cloak would look nice in that shade of pink You've decked me over in bobbins and lace My costume's become a disgrace

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Alas, my lady I've been bereaved Someone's just slandered my beautiful sleeve He's questioned my taste in every way My God, he said, I must be gay

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Alas, my lady you've done me wrong You've made my tunic much too long You've made it seven feet, ten inches, or more.... It drags across the floor!
